quotes: Kira Radinsky (Hebrew: קירה רדינסקי; born July 28, 1986) is a Ukrainian-born Israeli computer scientist, inventor and entrepreneur, specializing in predictive data mining.
Between 2004 and 2007, she served in the Intelligence Unit 8200 as a programmer, [5] and in 2006 she won the Israel Defense Prize as part of her unit's programming team.
Between 2004 and 2007, she served in the Intelligence Unit 8200 as a programmer, [5] and in 2006 she won the Israel Defense Prize as part of her unit's programming team.
Radinsky gained recognition after being selected by the MIT Technology Review to the '35 Innovators Under 35' list.

quotes: Dr. Kira Radinsky Named Lady Globes Magazine's 'Woman of the Year'
Kira Radinsky (Hebrew: קירה רדינסקי; born July 28, 1986) is a Ukrainian-born Israeli computer scientist, inventor and entrepreneur, specializing in predictive data mining.
Kira Radinsky (Hebrew: קירה רדינסקי; born July 28, 1986) is a Ukrainian-born Israeli computer scientist, inventor and entrepreneur, specializing in predictive data mining.
Radinsky was born in Kiev, Ukraine. Her parents separated before she was born, and she immigrated to Israel with her mother when she was 4.
She grew up in Nesher. Her mother was a mathematician by training.
Her work was described in the popular press as predicting the first in 130 years outbreak of cholera in Cuba, based on the pattern identified by mining of 150 years of
Since the end of 2021, Radinsky also is the Chief Executive Officer at Diagnostic Robotics, Tel Aviv, which she co-founded in 2019.
Radinsky lives in Zichron Yaacov,
